sentences.en: ...the warmth of her flesh.
sentences.cn: …她肌肤的温暖。

sentences.en: A fat man has much more flesh than a thin man.
sentences.cn: 胖人较瘦人肉多.

sentences.en: a freshwater fish with firm white flesh
sentences.cn: 一种肉色雪白、肉质紧实的淡水鱼

sentences.en: Charles' appeal is best observed in the flesh.
sentences.cn: 见到查尔斯本人才最能感受到他的魅力。

sentences.en: Cut the flesh from the olives and discard the stones.
sentences.cn: 把橄榄的果肉切下来，然后去除果核。

sentences.en: he has yet to put flesh on his ‘big idea’.
sentences.cn: 他的“伟大构思”还有待他充实具体内容。

sentences.en: His life was devoted to the pleasure of the flesh.
sentences.cn: 他一生贪图肉体上的舒适享受.

sentences.en: his story will make your flesh creep.
sentences.cn: 他的故事会令你毛骨悚然。

sentences.en: I have seen her on television, but never in the flesh.
sentences.cn: 我在电视上见到过她, 但从未见到过她本人.

sentences.en: I'm only flesh and blood, like anyone else.
sentences.cn: 我只是个凡人，和其他人一样。

sentences.en: It makes my flesh creep to think of it.
sentences.cn: 想到它就会让我毛骨悚然。

sentences.en: my body is his, his is mine: one flesh.
sentences.cn: 我的身体是他的，他的身体是我的，我俩成为一体。

sentences.en: Remove the seeds and stones and cube the flesh.
sentences.cn: 把籽和果核弄掉，将果肉切成小方块。

sentences.en: the film has gone the way of all flesh after being slated by the critics.
sentences.cn: 这部电影遭到批评家们的斥责后，从此悄无声息。

sentences.en: The flesh of his cheeks seemed to have yellowed.
sentences.cn: 他似乎有些面色发黄。

sentences.en: The flesh of the peach was sweet and juicy.
sentences.cn: 桃子的果肉甜而多汁.

sentences.en: The pack straps are too tight. They cut into the flesh.
sentences.cn: 背包带太紧, 勒得慌.

sentences.en: the sickening stench of burnt flesh
sentences.cn: 肉体燃烧所发出的令人作呕的恶臭

sentences.en: The thought of the horrible scene made my flesh creep.
sentences.cn: 想起那可怕的情景,我浑身都起鸡皮疙瘩.

sentences.en: The trap had cut deeply into the rabbit's flesh.
sentences.cn: 捕夹深深嵌入了兔子的肉里。

sentences.en: There may even be some wire or nylon biting into the flesh.
sentences.cn: 甚至可能有一些金属丝或者尼龙线勒到肉里。

words.tran_cn: 肉体的；肉欲的；耽于声色的

phrases.phrase: go the way of all flesh

phrases.tran_cn: 使感到害怕（或恐惧，厌恶）
一体（指两人精神和肉体结合关系，尤指婚姻）

phrases.phrase: put flesh on (the bones of) something

trans.tran_en: the soft part of the body of a person or animal that is between the skin and the bones
